data.text:
Amid #COVID19, @UNPeacekeeping missions have helped respond to the crisis while continuing to carry out their important protection work. 

We thank the men & women #ServingForPeace during this difficult time. 

#OnlyTogether can we end this pandemic. https://t.co/1AkYG6N3nb https://t.co/fgxMvkDjj0

From delivering life-saving vaccines & providing food aid, to supporting mental health, the UN works around the world to help communities in their #COVID19 response.

See examples in our latest  @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/m7lVw6SGBv

Health workers are on the front lines against #COVID19 and are essential for ensuring everyone gets protected.

As World Health Workers Week comes to an end, join us in thanking them for their critical work. 

#OnlyTogether can we end this pandemic. https://t.co/lsfaV8no4k https://t.co/jKK9I1YOjg

Despite #COVID19, @UNMAS experts continue working around the world to reduce the threat of landmines & explosive remnants of war, including by conducting training exercises. 

More on their efforts to create #SafeGround for all: https://t.co/cA3UmvaUAV

https://t.co/UX1SvVy59a

Urban trees: 
🌳 Increase biodiversity
🌳 Filter pollutants
🌳 Reduce carbon emissions

@FAO has more about the many benefits of urban forestry for both people & the planet. https://t.co/VmDT49Bcqi

https://t.co/qyFcczY4Ac

Mozambique: Catastrophe in northern part of the country beyond epic proportions, says UN, as it works with partners to scale up humanitarian response & assist displaced people. https://t.co/CZgC7qyPLV

Yemen is on the brink of famine.
400,000 children could die of hunger without urgent food & nutrition assistance.

Here's how you can help humanitarians save lives: https://t.co/Yr0z4ecopO #YemenCantWait https://t.co/7QHXwilanX

From ambulance drivers to doctors to emergency room nurses - people on the frontlines of the #COVID19 response across Africa are urging vigilance & solidarity to overcome the pandemic.

@africarenewal shares their stories this World Health Workers Week: https://t.co/LYL2qzvNgM https://t.co/sYiMYlqfpL

Combating misinformation is key to defeating the pandemic, countries pledge at #UNGA, showing support for the UN Verified initiative to spread trusted information and lifesaving advice. https://t.co/OEnFhMO8sI https://t.co/KSTsAaNJKt

Biking to work 🚴
Switching off the lights 💡
Buying sustainable fashion 👚

People around the world have logged more than 2 million of their #ClimateAction activities. 

Join the movement & download the app that can help you #ActNow to protect our planet. https://t.co/4i2kqgYQPL https://t.co/23JheCyHUQ

Landmines represent the worst of humanity. But efforts to eradicate them reflect humanity at its best. 

-- @antonioguterres tells Security Council, calling for an end to these inhumane threats. https://t.co/9Y93dWciZ4

Good #ClimateAction news: 
30 countries join @IMOHQ & @FAO in global initiative to tackle marine litter & clean up the world's oceans. 

The project aims to help the maritime transport & fishing sectors move towards a low-plastics future. https://t.co/3RusYlnVBy https://t.co/fVE1jkaYHR
Despite some progress, hate speech & violence are on the rise against Roma, with much of the abuse taking place online, warns independent @UNHumanRights expert on #RomaDay. https://t.co/FbC3asjlXm
Despite difficult conditions in Palestinian refugee camps across the Middle East, signs of hope are starting to emerge, head of @UNRWA tells UN member countries. https://t.co/lX6jLPpnq2

Join Thursday's global virtual event for #WorldAutismAwarenessDay on creating more inclusive workplaces as we recover better from #COVID19. 

Live from 10:00 EST: https://t.co/XzufRLAcK6 https://t.co/ZbxYiVULTa

Over 11,000 young people from all over the world are making their voices heard at #Youth2030 virtual Forum, sharing ideas as critical agents of change for the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/u7JMBXkAD7 https://t.co/Op6xjEpqYE

Myanmar: On-going clashes between the country's security forces and regional armed groups have left thousands displaced, says UN, as humanitarians work to provide critical assistance to those in need. 
https://t.co/NIYVw3XNeE

#COVID19 has shown us that no one is safe until everyone is safe. 

On Wednesday's #WorldHealthDay, see how the UN family came together to call for a fairer & healthier world for all.

https://t.co/q4HXoDpvcU

🎥 Watch as the UN commemorates the 27th anniversary of the genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda, and learn about our efforts to prevent similar acts in the future: https://t.co/4laKpTMFPN https://t.co/e9enZEyaMF

None of us are safe until all of us are safe. 

This #WorldHealthDay & every day, let's work to build a healthy world & defeat #COVID19. 

#OnlyTogether can we end this pandemic. https://t.co/lsfaV8EZsU https://t.co/jeUXKz0dQy

"I disowned my family to get a chance to survive and they all died. I was 12."  

-- Innocente Nyirahabimana's story is part of a UN virtual photo exhibit that pays tribute to the survivors of the 1994 genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda: https://t.co/n07ApIOYKb #Kwibuka https://t.co/lJAdghkKTE

As the #Youth2030 Forum gets underway, join @aminajmohammed, @UNYouthEnvoy & young leaders for a conversation on the key role of youth in achieving the #GlobalGoals in a post-pandemic world.

🎥 Watch here: https://t.co/q4DTpfsY0U #SDGLive https://t.co/Sn3sgkR6Ys

#COVID19 has shown us that no one is safe until everyone is safe. 

Wednesday's #WorldHealthDay is an opportunity to ensure the vulnerable communities hit hardest by the pandemic can access the health services they need to recover better. https://t.co/76nnFbK1Tw https://t.co/SjB4jmr0sA

27 years after the genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda, see the faces and hear the stories of survivors on Wednesday's International Day of Reflection. https://t.co/x0tUxrXFUQ #Kwibuka https://t.co/stQxYIIyIZ

Wednesday's #WorldHealthDay is an opportunity to show support for ensuring that people everywhere can access #COVID19 vaccines.

#OnlyTogether can we bring the pandemic to an end. https://t.co/lsfaV8no4k https://t.co/OV2tXbIaA1

"As we join in solidarity with the people of Rwanda, we must take a hard look at today’s world and ensure that we heed the lessons of 27 years ago."

-- @antonioguterres on Wednesday's 27th anniversary of the genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda. https://t.co/fm2c8GJ6hL #Kwibuka https://t.co/bg7onicJvW

Mali: Serious challenges, including political, security, human rights & humanitarian threats plague the country, Security Council hears. 

@UN_MINUSMA grappling with repeated attacks & losses due to constant threat from armed groups. https://t.co/r4DreTF69g

#COVID19 vaccines must be made available to everyone to bring the pandemic to an end. 

On Wednesday's #WorldHealthDay, more from @WHO on how we can build a fairer, healthier world for all: https://t.co/76nnFbsquW https://t.co/98L1TRtBBv

More than one million people perished in the 1994 genocide against the Tutsi in Rwanda.

On Wednesday's International Day of Reflection, we honour those who were murdered and reflect on the suffering of those who survived. https://t.co/QNjGzGwL4U #Kwibuka https://t.co/7XCLZlhKRS

The Democratic Republic of the Congo is home to the largest number of people in urgent need of food assistance in the world, with 1 in 3 suffering from acute hunger.

The record high number is being driven by conflict, warns @WFP & @FAO. https://t.co/Zz7Sk5xd5K

We will...
🤾 play 
📣 cheer
🎉 celebrate

... again when everyone, everywhere is protected against #COVID19.

On Tuesday's International #SportDay & every day, help us spread the word: #OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic! https://t.co/lsfaV8EZsU https://t.co/O8ckPjO33k

The reduction in physical activity amid the pandemic could result in 5 million premature deaths annually.

On Tuesday's International #SportDay, join @UNESCO in calling for quality physical education to support #COVID19 recovery. https://t.co/isSmHIkm3N https://t.co/QVLEXr8Zq3

#OnlyTogether can we bring the pandemic to an end, and vaccines are a key part of the solution to the #COVID19 crisis.

Learn more about how the UN is addressing the challenge of ensuring people all over the world have access to lifesaving vaccines. https://t.co/2BW1R1Ny9P

Sport is a powerful tool to promote respect, tolerance & solidarity, contributing to the achievement of the #GlobalGoals.

More on Tuesday's International #SportDay: https://t.co/lA1ta09raS https://t.co/a4bRf6aIO2

#ClimateAction gets a boost: 

The @WorldBank announces new measures to help achieve the #ParisAgreement, from raising climate financing to helping countries transition out of coal, including new jobs & cleaner, renewable alternatives. https://t.co/ec4X5AtVHJ

On Tuesday's International #SportDay, join our call for the world to work as one team to end the pandemic everywhere so we can back to the things we love - like sport. 

#OnlyTogether we will play again. https://t.co/lsfaV8no4k https://t.co/znFX9dw5C8

A bag of beans travels a distance equivalent to a roundtrip journey between New York City and Paris to reach those most in need in Haiti. 

Watch how @WFP is helping to achieve #ZeroHunger. https://t.co/IYY1h66wiB
https://t.co/urjdUEFeg8

2 in 3 students worldwide are still affected by full or partial school closures.
Many of them cannot access remote learning. 

See how @UNESCO is supporting countries to ensure education doesn't stop: https://t.co/UgAa6ZDrWq https://t.co/e79Eo0K1rz

The climate crisis is a menace to the world.

Our latest @TikTok_us shows how anyone can be a #ClimateAction Superhero & help protect our one & only planet.

Get inspired to #ActNow: https://t.co/nAjeCApKJ4 https://t.co/HDaeT2JQm7

Wearing the right face mask the right way can help slow the spread of #COVID19. 

More tips on how to #WearAMask and protect yourself & others: https://t.co/doHQ5dLJ3J https://t.co/X67Kd4j45d

It's World Health Workers Week. 

Health heroes are on the front lines against #COVID19 and are essential for ensuring everyone gets protected. They must be given access to vaccines and get the support they need to continue their critical work. 

Join us in thanking them! https://t.co/kFVdw37fNN

🌎 Climate
💰 Debt
💉 Vaccines
📈 Economic recovery

These are some of the topics that will be discussed at this week’s @IMFNews - @WorldBank Spring Meetings. https://t.co/UOs5waF6z4 https://t.co/iQQ2JXWXig

"The international community has a responsibility to come together and cooperate to support a sustainable global recovery."

-- @antonioguterres on the need for reducing debt burden & increasing liquidity to rebuild better from #COVID19. https://t.co/AEAgoABoai https://t.co/mPEolQok9u

Monday is the International Day of Conscience. 

In the face of the #COVID19 pandemic - and always - let's focus on promoting tolerance & solidarity and helping those in need. https://t.co/oiqkSVIY8H https://t.co/XGbp1B7rp8

Ahead of International #SportDay, join our call for solidarity to make sure everyone is protected against #COVID19 so we can get back to the things we love - like sport. 

#OnlyTogether will we cheer again. https://t.co/lsfaV8no4k https://t.co/7ASrCPyAwL

"No daughter of mine will be cut."

Like 95% of women in her community, Margaret Chepoteltel underwent female genital mutilation as a child, causing lifelong health problems. 

She now works to #endFGM, with support from @UN_Women & @GlobalSpotlight.
https://t.co/Oy9W6o3d5u

"Landmines, explosive remnants of war & improvised explosive devices disproportionally affect the vulnerable, the forcibly displaced, the dispossessed & children."

-- @antonioguterres calls for an end to landmines on Sunday's #MineAwarenessDay. https://t.co/QQa8OKyU7p https://t.co/fweoYPmpyM

The @UN_News_Centre wants to hear from YOU. 

Take this short survey to share which UN News stories you find most useful: https://t.co/4BCsqEN3TV https://t.co/pkMv4Thlat

Women in traditionally male-dominated jobs, such as demining, can have a huge impact in societies characterised by conservative gender norms. 

Find out about Afghanistan’s first women deminers from @UNMAS on Sunday's #MineAwarenessDay: https://t.co/qlwH2UTWxR https://t.co/HBrE316Fvc

We hope our followers who celebrate #Easter find a way to safely mark the occasion even at this difficult time. 

#OnlyTogether, people of all faiths can and will defeat #COVID19 – with cooperation, solidarity & belief in our common humanity. https://t.co/gvnoS1pr84

Landmines & explosive remnants of war impede the path to peace & development. Ridding the world of these deadly weapons would allow individuals & communities to live in safe homes & safe environments.

More from @UNMAS on Sunday's #MineAwarenessDay: https://t.co/QQa8OKQuYX https://t.co/F5rFasb4l1

🔹 How can parents help their children navigate #COVID19 losses?
🔹 How should they explain these difficult times to them?
🔹 What are signs of mental health issues we should pay attention to?

@UNICEF shares some guidance.

https://t.co/J5LeHeJxTY

"To rebuild better, we must ensure women have an equal voice in all aspects of pandemic response."

-- @antonioguterres on his conversation with Peaches Dinnoo, a frontline worker from Trinidad & Tobago. https://t.co/ofKW0tTUkm https://t.co/eA9Mu4MRJr

Happy birthday to our UN Messenger of Peace Jane Goodall (@JaneGoodallInst), and thank you for your tireless commitment to protecting the environment!

https://t.co/7IqM2jdcRv #GlobalGoals https://t.co/WAAqt8gBrX

Hunger is both a cause & result of conflict. 

Sustainable food systems can help break that cycle by promoting peace, which in turn facilitates the supply of safe & nutritious food. 

More from @IFAD ⤵️
https://t.co/3n8sMG3F3F

"Unless we take decisive action on debt & liquidity challenges, we risk another 'lost decade' for many developing countries."

-- @antonioguterres urges international cooperation to support a sustainable global recovery from #COVID19. https://t.co/lYkXLBWccF https://t.co/7prf3kzZq6

More #WomenInPeacekeeping = more perspectives & solutions in a crisis.

Women are key to @UNPeacekeeping's work around the world to prevent the spread of conflict & violence. https://t.co/JlWYyF80DR https://t.co/QZhCaqW09M

Ahead of International #SportDay, show your support for levelling the playing field so that people around the world can get a vaccine - and we can all play again. 

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. https://t.co/lsfaV8no4k https://t.co/iQ0mwLzPtW

This week, @UN_Women's global #GenerationEquality Forum brought together governments, international organizations, the private sector and young people in an effort to advance global commitments to gender equality. 
https://t.co/i2WZKAM9UU https://t.co/Ujc5WHVzHx

Women & men #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping protect civilians & help communities in many different ways.

Here's an example from @UNMISSmedia, where peacekeepers have repaired a key road network, improving communication, trade & access. https://t.co/Z5pTgdsSrt https://t.co/wvGAKIbu8I

Despite #COVID19, our @UNMAS colleagues continue their vital work clearing landmines & explosive remnants of war, for a world where people don't have to be afraid of their next step.

More ahead of Sunday's #MineAwarenessDay: https://t.co/AeClwi5Xbw https://t.co/MrkvKZl73f

"We're all working together on the same thing, that's what’s great about the UN."

-- @unmissmedia head David Shearer on the important work of our colleagues on the front line who, despite #COVID19, continue their vital mission to protect the most vulnerable.

People with autism should never face discrimination when seeking medical care.

#StandUp4HumanRights on #WorldAutismAwarenessDay & every day. https://t.co/9VIsDiDLjn https://t.co/OQCk7jVKqu

34 million people around the world are on the brink of famine — and the slightest shock could tip them over the edge. 

@WFP explains the factors behind a looming catastrophe and our global duty to take action to #FightFamine. https://t.co/sNF2U6UbE0 https://t.co/53qnHBCVvJ

"Pandemic recovery is an opportunity to rethink our systems to ensure that people with autism can realize their full potential."
-
- @antonioguterres on Friday's #WorldAutismAwarenessDay. https://t.co/RuQIeTwa9g https://t.co/p9Bw2ZOVL9

The worldwide response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity. People are spreading kindness through their words & deeds -- while inspiring others to do the same.

No act of goodwill is too small in the fight against #coronavirus.

🎨: @megatoeDesign https://t.co/TttiQ32hKE

The climate crisis and biodiversity loss are seen as the most pressing challenges over the next 10 years, according to new @UNESCO survey.

We need urgent #ClimateAction now!
https://t.co/afLk5V6jV2

Despite #COVID19, @UNMAS continues its important work for a world free from the threat of landmines and explosive hazards, where people don't fear their next step.
More ahead of Sunday's Mine Awareness Day: https://t.co/cA3UmvaUAV

https://t.co/VasHCfLYh1

An entire generation is in danger in Yemen.
Together we can help them survive this urgent humanitarian crisis.
-- @Refugees Goodwill Ambassador Cate Blanchett.
Find out how you can support: https://t.co/aM6b3kwkKy

 https://t.co/NEusyxMQXL

♻ Reduce
♻ Reuse
♻ Recycle

Take #ClimateAction by making small changes in your daily life to reduce waste. https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV #ActNow https://t.co/V2pDzhwMpK
Viet Nam assumes the presidency of the Security Council for the month of April. Follow @VietNam_UN for updates. https://t.co/4wml2VG3n2 https://t.co/zTSdtUBRr4

.#WomensHistoryMonth is coming to an end, but every day women continue to break barriers and pave the way for an equal future.

Join @UN_Women in building #GenerationEquality: https://t.co/DB8Zgo8omZ

#Myanmar: “The urgency for a solution to this crisis could not be clearer.”

-- UN Special Envoy @SchranerBurgen1 tells Security Council, calling for a firm, unified and resolute international response. 
https://t.co/Wfiv1LQlu6

"We must deliver concrete action now to protect the most vulnerable from more severe & frequent climate impacts."

-- @AminaJMohammed calls for urgent #ClimateAction at ministerial meeting in preparation for November's #COP26. https://t.co/Ogj8tq2bvC

Ahead of Sunday's Mine Awareness Day, this @UNMAS virtual exhibit features some of the brave women & men working around the world to protect civilians from the threat of landmines & explosive remnants of war. 👉 https://t.co/VJdYQCyqVs https://t.co/kuLjiIIrX3

Following last week's devastating fire at Kutupalong refugee camp in Bangladesh, UN agencies are stepping up efforts to help thousands of Rohingya refugee families left homeless.
https://t.co/RRKgI1Sa9N

"2021 is the year to put things back on track, and I believe things are happening in that direction."

@antonioguterres discusses #COVID19, inequalities, #ClimateAction & more on  @Monocle24's "Foreign Desk". ⬇️ https://t.co/Vu6LEy9pEr

No child should suffer because of who they are.

All children deserve love, protection & equal rights, including the right to an education free of discrimination & bullying.

On #TransDayOfVisibility, join @UNAIDS in calling for the rights of transgender children to be protected. https://t.co/nKOEyoqy2s

Disturbing reports of targeted attacks against civilians have emerged from northern Mozambique, marking a serious escalation of violence and volatility in the Cabo Delgado region.
https://t.co/LkM9toYDM5

It's really important that every country, every individual focusses on doing the things that can keep the transmissions down, while we scale up vaccines.

— @WHO's Chief Scientist @doctorsoumya on what you can do to help reduce spread of #COVID19 variants. https://t.co/R0cJ31mJsu https://t.co/sIq4fz0ujQ

At #SyriaConf2021, the UN, partners & the donor community confirmed $4.4 billion to support humanitarian, resilience & development activities for the Syria crisis response in 2021. #InvestInHumanity 
https://t.co/QZqk0sz8bm
.@WHO calls for further studies & says all hypotheses remain open following the publication of report on #COVID19 origins by an international expert team. https://t.co/rr0IiN6xXu

Rethinking urban areas will be key to rebuilding better from #COVID19.

By prioritizing affordable housing, basic services & sustainable mobility for all, cities can lead the way towards a greener, healthier & more inclusive future. 

More from @UNHABITAT: https://t.co/1aHMlPpENd https://t.co/cppVzqfhGU

The #COVID19 crisis has had disproportionate impacts on women, who are still being left behind in the world of work.

To build back better & fairer, employment policies must put gender equality at the core of the recovery efforts. 

More from @ILO:
https://t.co/ALNyywKcpo

Syria: After 10 years of conflict, nearly 90% of the population lives below poverty line.

The international community is coming together on Tuesday to pledge support for 13+ million Syrians that need urgent humanitarian aid. https://t.co/wEnOw93dZ9 #SyriaConf2021 via @UNOCHA https://t.co/tXie5nCVFY

"Unless we take decisive action on debt and liquidity challenges, we risk another 'lost decade' for many developing countries."

-- @antonioguterres urges international cooperation to support a sustainable global recovery from #COVID19. https://t.co/lYkXLBWccF https://t.co/0mNGr2lE3G

We've all missed doing the things we love. But #OnlyTogether can we overcome the pandemic.

Check out the many ways people are coming together & showing unity amid #COVID19, in our latest @TwitterMoments https://t.co/ESUz5N3SLN

"For millions of war-weary Syrian children, hope is all they have."

-- @unicefchief asks Security Council to match kids' hope with the solutions & support they need and the lasting peace they deserve. https://t.co/5tLR4gEfon

The Action for Peacekeeping initiative was launched by @antonioguterres three years ago to strengthen peacekeeping & make operations more effective by promoting collective action by all partners. 

More about @UNPeacekeeping: https://t.co/wJQAozBoga #A4P
https://t.co/UGrHUfyYGu

This week, @UN_Women's global #GenerationEquality Forum brings together governments, international organizations, the private sector and young people in an effort to advance global commitments to gender equality. https://t.co/50r1ExgKcX https://t.co/eDVGfQoeeX

#COVID19 has accelerated digital transformations, marking a turning point in the e-commerce sector.

To ensure digital trade benefits everyone, everywhere, we must address existing digital divides. More from @UNCTAD: https://t.co/nZsOOa2mkZ https://t.co/kPvHeHPzCf

"The international community has a responsibility to come together and cooperate to support a sustainable global recovery."

-- @antonioguterres on the need for reducing debt burden & increasing liquidity to rebuilding better from #COVID19. https://t.co/lYkXLCdNBf https://t.co/vfCbftaoP5

Strong women can help inspire strong girls-and together, we can all help achieve #GenerationEquality. 

As #WomensHistoryMonth comes to an end, @UN_Women highlights some of the changemakers who will continue fighting for an equal future; today & every day. https://t.co/qB4dKDxAua https://t.co/QoXUMSCnXY

Like all viruses, #COVID19 is changing as it spreads. Limit your exposure by:
😷wearing a mask 
🧼👐 washing hands 
🙂↔️🙂 physical distancing
🪟 opening doors & windows to let fresh air in.

Help share more verified information that saves lives: https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/AxMYwRFtZD

During these times of high-stress and uncertainty amid the #COVID19 pandemic, it's important to look after yourself - and others. 

Stay safe and stay positive. We are in this together -- and we will get through this together. 

🎨: @aysegulaltinel https://t.co/LYlK2c2WHc

A "hidden epidemic" of drug use among the elderly is on the rise, all while many older people struggle with their health & well-being due to the #COVID19 crisis. 

The latest report from the International Narcotics Control Board has more. 
https://t.co/xbJi3sxJ0g

Every second, the equivalent of one garbage truck full of textiles is landfilled or burned, polluting our environment and adding harmful greenhouse gases. 

Be a #ClimateAction Superhero - mend, donate and keep clothing out of landfills! https://t.co/nAjeCApKJ4 #ActNow https://t.co/wBo2LNXzSW

"I decided to go beyond social & cultural barriers and take action.”

Iman & 10 other women launched Yemen's 1st private solar grid, providing clean, low cost energy to their community.

@UNDP shares her inspiring story ⤵️

https://t.co/aNsi5ohZM8

In the Democratic Republic of the Congo, @MONUSCO regularly deploys combat helicopters to protect civilians & support operations carried out against armed groups. 

More about the @UNPeacekeeping mission: https://t.co/0PnjVplfUB #A4P https://t.co/lPqJqL0cJ6
